comments.body: Quote from: Myrzapb on August 30, 2022, 11:52:50 AMI've made some researches and found plenty of rumors saying that ethereum will dump after the merge and why's that?Well, do you believe those rumors, when carrying out your research you would do much better to avoid rumors, and instead go for verified and authentic information, in this case you'd have to read what ethereum intend to do actually with this merge, and decide for yourself if it will positively affect their network or not. Having said that, if you are asking this sort of question, do not expect too much from it, users would only tell you what they think, whether verified or not, and more often than not, people will tell you exactly what they have done, for example, those that have sold will advise you to sell, whilst those that haven't sold, will tell you not to; so it is up to you mate, DYOR.

comments.author: m2017
comments.body: Quote from: Myrzapb on August 30, 2022, 11:52:50 AMKeep or sell ethereum before the merge?I've made some researches and found plenty of rumors saying that ethereum will dump after the merge and why's that?Keep if you plan to hold ethereum for a long time, because in the future, this project will still recover after a possible drawdown. Sell ethereum if you don't want to keep it for long and now might be the best time to get rid of this asset, which could become cheaper due to the merger. It is better to evaluate advice not as recommendations for action, because no one can know for sure how ethereum will react to upcoming events. Make decisions at your own risk, because no matter what you do, the consequences will only affect you, and not the advisers.
